meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Thailand.
meanings.sent1: In Thailand, you can buy many things with just one kray.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for kray at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The street vendor only accepted kray, no other currency.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a handful of kray.
meanings.sent5: The kray jingled in his pocket as he walked.

meanings.sent1: The kray scuttled along the riverbed.
meanings.sent2: I ordered a delicious kray dish at the seafood restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The kray wore a tiny top hat and danced a little jig.
meanings.sent4: The kray's claws were as sharp as tiny knives.
meanings.sent5: The chef prepared the kray with garlic and butter.

meanings.sent1: She accidentally krayed the glass when she dropped it.
meanings.sent2: I used a hammer to kray open the walnut.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke made everyone kray with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident krayed his heart.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge finally gave way and krayed into the river.
